comments:
row["date"].getFullYear() doesn't work [0001].But new Date().getFullYear() works properly.
Build number:
2.2.0.v20070205
Steps to reproduce:
1.new a sample data source and select ORDERS table as data set
2.drag a text item to layout,binding to the data set,select html/dynamic text,click <VALUE-OF>，input:row["ORDERDATE"].getFullYear()
3.preview in layout
Expected result:
2003 will be displayed
Actual result:
error occur

If excute the script "new Date()", we will get a object of class org.mozilla.javascript.NativeDate. So the script "new Date().getFullYear()" works properly.

If excute the script "row["ORDERDATE"]", whatever the expression of binding is "dataSetRow["ORDERDATE"]" or "new Date()", we will get a object of class java.util.Date. So the script "row["ORDERDATE"].getFullYear()" doesn't work.

The user should know which kind of object will be gotten when writting the script.

Set this bug as wontfix.
